main event: Two individuals reported seeing a bright, bluish-white, round light the size of a basketball at an altitude of at least 1,000 feet near Elizabeth City, North Carolina on December 6, 1957. The light remained stationary for 5-7 minutes before suddenly disappearing.
interesting points: The light was described as extremely bright and bluish-white in color.
The object was estimated to be about the size of a basketball.
The object remained stationary for approximately 5-7 minutes before disappearing.
Two separate reports were filed for sightings of a fast-moving, bright white object east of Elizabeth City, North Carolina on December 6, 1957.
The second sighting described the object as about 1/4 the size of the moon, burning bright white, and moving very fast eastward then northward before disappearing near Lake Drummond.
sighted object: bright, bluish-white, round light the size of a basketball
